ud7.8:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud7.8:1.3: Now at that time Venerable Mahākaccāna was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight and mindfulness of the body well-established in himself.
ud7.8:2.1: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ud7.8:3.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud7.8:4.2: be established in the body, constant:
ud7.8:4.3: ‘It might not be, and it might not be mine,
ud7.8:4.4: It will not be, and it will not be mine.’
ud7.8:4.5: Meditating stage by stage on that,
ud7.8:4.6: in time they’d cross over clinging.”
